body:
The docs speak several times about the possibility to install a `@local` version of a package.

I checked the buildin repo and the docs but never found a full explanation of `version(...)`. Also [spack.package](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/spack.html#spack.package.PackageBase.version) seems to skip exactly that method in the doc strings.

Is there a `version('local', 'file://~/src/myPackage')` syntax? (this fails)

I would actually like to fetch from such an URI for development :)
title: version('local', ...)
